intro: Tetrazygia barbata, commonly known as the hairy tetrazygia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. The leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
